title: Tribes and Genealogies of Judah and Simeon
shortSummary: 1 Chronicles 4 details the genealogies and families of the tribes of Judah and Simeon, highlighting their descendants, cities, and notable individuals. This chapter emphasizes God's providential care in preserving His people’s lineage and the importance of honoring family heritage within God's plan.
timeline: c. 10th century BC - Period of the United Monarchy under King David

keyCharacters.name: Jabez
keyCharacters.description: A descendant of Judah noted for his honorable character and fervent prayer for God’s blessing and protection, which God graciously granted.

keyCharacters.name: Ashur
keyCharacters.description: Father of Tekoa, mentioned with his two wives and their offspring, illustrating the detailed genealogies of Judah’s families.

keyCharacters.name: Mered
keyCharacters.description: A man who married Bithiah, the daughter of Pharaoh, showing the integration of Gentile lineage into Israel’s tribes.

keyCharacters.name: Shimei
keyCharacters.description: A descendant of Simeon who had many children, contrasting with the smaller families of his brethren, highlighting God’s blessing on some lines.

definitions.definition: A family group descended from Jahath, representing one of the clans within the tribe of Judah.
An ancient name associated with Bethlehem, indicating the geographical and tribal origins of certain families.
In this context, 'coast' refers to territory or land allotment, a key aspect of God’s promise to His people.
Military leaders or commanders responsible for leading groups of men, as seen in the Simeonites’ expedition to Mount Seir.

outline.heading: Genealogies of Judah’s Families
outline.description: This section lists the sons and descendants of Judah, including notable families and craftsmen, emphasizing the growth and diversity within the tribe.

outline.heading: Notable Individuals and Prayers
outline.description: Focuses on Jabez, whose prayer for God’s blessing and protection is highlighted as an example of faith and dependence on God.

outline.heading: Genealogies of Simeon’s Families and Their Cities
outline.description: Details the descendants of Simeon, their cities, and settlements, showing their established presence and inheritance within Judah’s territory.

outline.heading: Expansion and Conquest in Later Days
outline.description: Describes the Simeonites’ military actions during King Hezekiah’s reign, including their conquest of the Amalekites and settlement in new territories.

application: Trust God in prayer like Jabez, boldly asking for His blessing, guidance, and protection in all areas of life.
Value and honor your family heritage as part of God’s providential plan, recognizing the importance of godly lineage.
Commit to faithful service and craftsmanship in your calling, as the descendants of Judah did, contributing to God’s kingdom.
Be courageous in facing spiritual and physical challenges, trusting God to grant victory and establish your place.

keyVerses.text: And Jabez was more honourable than his brethren: and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, Because I bare him with sorrow.
keyVerses.significance: Introduces Jabez as a man of honor whose life and prayer exemplify faith and reliance on God despite difficult beginnings.

keyVerses.text: And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, Oh that thou wouldest bless me indeed, and enlarge my coast, and that thine hand might be with me, and that thou wouldest keep me from evil, that it may not grieve me! And God granted him that which he requested.
keyVerses.significance: Demonstrates the power of earnest prayer and God’s willingness to bless and protect those who seek Him sincerely.

keyVerses.text: And these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and smote their tents, and the habitations that were found there, and destroyed them utterly unto this day, and dwelt in their rooms: because there was pasture there for their flocks.
keyVerses.significance: Shows God’s providence in granting His people victory and new inheritance, emphasizing obedience and trust in His timing.
